It cant be a Youtube poll, that would encourage youtubers to interfere more than they did this year. They have too much influence already. The last thing we want is for the mob vote to just become what mob will the most youtubers back.

I agree with this idea. I think the official Minecraft.net website should be the best place for voting to take place, as every Minecraft player should have access, as opposed to social media platforms. Additionally, social media users can heavily sway other voters. Voting should be absent of any commenting, and be kept anonymous. My suggestion is: on Minecraft.net, login to your account, click on a voting link, and vote during the allotted voting time for each round of voting.
This is an excellent way to get truly everyone involved, especially people who have to use their parents twitter and get yelled at just to have the chance of getting their mob

That is very good idea. This will allow everyone to benefit from voting
I made a post similar to this, which was stated for any kind of vote, be it mobs, or blocks, or biomes.

This is a great idea because many of the voters did not have stakes involved. People who have stakes involved own a copy of the game, and therefore a User Interface Update should be implemented so that voting contains more efficacy and is less likely to be swayed by large-scale content creators wanting to influence the game for their own purposes (such as a speedrunner not wanting another Hostile Mob to challenge their content creation purposes).
Voteing polls should last longer to accommodate for people with busy lifes so that everyone gets a chance to vote.
I agree. I don't want to create an account that I'll only use once a year. Minecraft users will be closer to the game itself, so I think it should be done there over the course of a few days

No version exclusivity was declared in the official Minecraft Instagram post nor anywhere on the Minecraft Experiences website. Because this is such an exciting event - the first in-person event to feature a cape in many years - many people have already purchased tickets and made travel plans. The cape was used to advertise the event and encourage people to buy tickets, so please consider making it available to Java players as well. It has been confirmed by Minecraft Experience support that the cape is for Bedrock Edition as of now, though this could change if our feedback is heard. Thanks!
Yes, please fix this :D

I agree, this is a great idea! Please add the experience cape to java edition too.

Offering the cape for java edition would encourage more people to buy tickets for the event and make the extra effort and travel plans to come.

Adding to java would also make people talk about the cape more, therefore generating more promotion for the event.
 
This event is also particularly special, being the first large-scale Minecraft in-person event since Minecon in 2016. Let's celebrate this new era of Minecraft's history by adding the cape to both versions, so more people can enjoy the fun! It will be a great reward for dedicated community members who love the game and the Minecraft community.
 
In addition, almost every major cape introduced since the Migrator cape in 2021 has been added to both editions of the game. Adding the cape to both java and bedrock would only continue this trend and not be out of the ordinary. Dare I say, it may even be a bit odd and arbitrary for this cape to only be in one edition.

Thank you for listening to our feedback!
I agree. Please add the cape to both java and bedrock, please! Java edition players make up a huge portion of minecraft players overall!

I would really appreciate it if the cape was confirmed for Java.  I was really looking forward to going with my friends until I realized it wasn't confirmed for java.  Any official comment from Mojang would be appreciated so I at least know whether I am going to get tickets to the event or not.

None of the winning candidates were even fleshed out that much. Phantoms are just a nuisance that appear when you don't sleep enough. Foxes are just low tier wolves that are harder to tame and don't add much of an "update" to Taiga forests. Goats are only good for their horns, which can only be really enjoyed in multiplayer. Glow squids are just as worthless as regular squid and add just one limited crafting ingredient. Allays are just inefficient clean up crews for lazy players. And, the Sniffers give us 2 plants that aren't even remotely interesting. The whole point of these mobs' existence was to bait people into participating in the Minecraft Live events. No one wins except Mojang.

Why would anyone celebrate death?

I agree, this is an awesome idea. My family celebrates Dia de los Muertos and it would be a real treat to be able to celebrate it in-game as well. It could be so cool if the Land of the Dead was represented by the Nether or something!

Maybe it could be an affect on the nether. A structure or a biome that's rare. As far as the nether goes, I know it's not explicitly below, the overworld, it's not explicitly hell. All in all it seems like a scary place, but that doesn't mean it has to be all negative. Maybe there could be a place that's kind of like christianity's purgatory, a greek Elysium, or a Land of the Dead. Of course on Dia de Los Muertos there could be something happen there that enlivens it. 

Maybe it's a sort of ancient village. On Dia de Los Muertos the windows and stuff all light up, and the village becomes "alive," and now you can go around and make trades with the villagers.

Maybe in a way their trades can be a celebration of life, where the villagers ask for flowers, cookies, chocolate. Specific personalized items. In addition to this they might trrade unique enchantments, or music discs. Masks, candles. I think that's a way that this could be put into the game in a really cool way.
